fullText: The Magic Kingdom has a new monarch. Josh D’Amaro will succeed Bob Iger as CEO. Lauren Scala finds out how you can win a trip to Palm Coast, Florida. No Pur. Nec. Void where prohibited. 21+ Ends 2/1. Subject to Official Rules. Da Brat and Jesseca “Judy” Harris-Dupart tell Sara Gore about their new book detailing their relationship, “The Way Love Goes.” Ashley Bellman visits the Oculus, where The Strangers Project features more than 100,000 letters of people telling their stories. This highbrow-lowbrow take on surf and turf has made it to the fast-food big leagues. The last time 2026 co-host Cortina d’Ampezzo had an Olympic moment? Seventy years ago. Join us as we go back in time to see what was happening in 1956. Jenner needed help making her Super Bowl pick, so she called the expert for some advice. NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell said Monday he doesn’t expect Bad Bunny to say anything divisive during his Super Bowl halftime performance. Who lip-synced the national anthem at the Super Bowl? Who had the longest performance? Who messed up the lyrics? Find out here before your Super Bowl party. Markiplier’s “Iron Lung,” an adaptation of an indie video game, pulled in $18.19 million at the domestic box office on opening weekend. After seven seasons, “The Kelly Clarkson Show” will go off the air, the show announced Monday, saying host Clarkson “made the personal decision to step away.” NBC’s Super Bowl LX pregame show in the Bay Area will feature Alcatraz Island, the first ever live broadcast to take place there. Inspired by a homework assignment in her social studies class, Connecticut student Eniola Taiwo pushed for the LAFD to be honored on the Walk of Fame. “Southern Charm” star Shep Rose sits down with Lauren Scala to chat about the Craig-Austen drama, dating, and the benefits of ayahuasca. Paula Pell, Kapil Talkwalkar, & Julia Duffy chat with Lauren Scala about the new dark comedy “The ‘Burbs.” Here are our biggest takeaways from the 68th Grammy Awards. Bad Bunny makes Grammy Awards history with win for album of the year for Spanish-language ‘Debí Tirar Más Fotos’. During his monologue, Trevor Noah joked about Nicki Minaj meeting and praising Donald Trump at the White House. “Melania: Twenty Days to History” brought in $7 million, according to Amazon MGM Studios, which distributed the film.

textIssues: Show title not found in text
dtliExcerpt: Don’t be fooled by the title of Disney’s latest film-to-stage transfer. Aladdin may be named after its lead street urchin character, but the musical comedy that just opened at the New Amsterdam Theatre is all about one character: the Genie. That’s due to the casting of the energetic James Monroe Iglehart, who all but erases the memory of Robin Williams, the voice of the Genie in the 1992 animated film. It’s rare that you see an actor playing a character he was born to play in a career-defining performance. Iglehart, last seen on Broadway in Memphis, uses his background in improv to create a comedic and charismatic Genie, who’s equal parts Fats Waller, Luther Vandross and Oprah Winfrey (“You get a wish! You get a wish!”).
